1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
a Naamathite, or inhabitant of Naamah

2.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, crossed, i.e. (abstractly) transit; used only adverbially, on account of, in order that
to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment

3.brief: properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

4.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time

6.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)

7.brief: properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

8.brief: to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

9.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to tan (by sunburning); figuratively (as if by a piercing ray) to scan
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

10.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

11.brief: a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
(only in plural as abstract) adolescence; figuratively, vigor
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)

12.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to suck, by implication, to relish, or (intransitively) be sweet
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)

13.brief: to commiserate; by implication, to spare
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
to debar (negatively or positively) from benefit or injury
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

14.brief: food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively)
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
properly, bitterness; concretely, a bitter thing; specifically bile; also venom (of a serpent)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

15.brief: probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

16.brief: a poisonous plant, probably the poppy (from its conspicuous head); generally poison (even of serpents)
to suck; causatively, to give milk
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
an asp or other venomous serpent

17.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
honey (from its stickiness); by analogy, syrup

18.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to leap for joy, i.e. exult, wave joyously

19.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to crack in pieces, literally or figuratively
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to pluck off; specifically to flay, strip or rob
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

20.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
tranquil; (in a bad sense) careless; abstractly, security
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks

21.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare

22.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
to press (intransitive), i.e. be narrow; figuratively, be in distress
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
toiling; concretely, a laborer; figuratively, sorrowful
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

23.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, eaten, i.e. food; also flesh, i.e. body

24.brief: to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
military equipment, i.e. (collectively) arms (offensive or defensive), or (concretely) an arsenal
iron (as cutting); by extension, an iron implement
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris

25.brief: to pull out, up or off
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
the back, i.e. (by extensive) the person
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
properly, bitterness; concretely, a bitter thing; specifically bile; also venom (of a serpent)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)

26.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to puff, in various applications (literally, to inflate, blow hard, scatter, kindle, expire; figuratively, to disesteem)
properly, to be broken up (with any violent action) i.e. (figuratively) to fear
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)

27.brief: to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)

28.brief: to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
produce, i.e. a crop or (figuratively) wealth
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to flow; figuratively, to stretch out; causatively, to pour out or down; figuratively, to deliver over
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

29.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
